games.title: Human Knot
games.description: A group of people stand in a circle, each person grabs the right hand of someone across from them, then the left hand of a different person. The challenge is to untangle the knot without letting go of hands.
games.setup: Everyone stands in a circle. Close your eyes (for fairness) and reach across with your right hand to grab someone else's right hand. Then reach across with your left hand to grab a different person's left hand.
howToPlay: Form a circle with 6-12 people
Everyone closes their eyes
Reach across and grab someone's right hand with your right hand
Now grab a different person's left hand with your left hand
Open eyes and try to untangle the knot
No one can let go of hands
The group works together to step over or under arms to untangle
Success when everyone is standing in a circle holding hands

games.title: Exquisite Corpse
games.description: A collaborative drawing game where each person draws part of a figure on a folded piece of paper, only seeing the previous person's final line.
games.setup: Fold a piece of paper into 3 or 4 sections. Each person will draw in one section.
howToPlay: Fold paper into equal sections
First person draws a head in the top section, extending a line to the fold
Fold down to hide the drawing, revealing only the line
Next person draws a body connected to that line
Repeat until all sections are filled
Unfold to reveal the hilarious combined creature
Take turns being the 'artist' for each section

games.title: Blob Tag
games.description: When tagged, players must freeze and hold their position. Other players can 'rescue' them by high-fiving while the blob isn't looking.
games.setup: Designate one person as 'It' and one area as the safe zone.
howToPlay: One person is 'It' and tries to tag others
When tagged, players become frozen statues
Frozen players stand still with arms out
Other players can rescue frozen players with a high-five
The blob (person who is It) cannot tag while looking at rescuers
If caught looking away from rescuers, the blob must freeze
Game continues until all players are frozen or time runs out

games.title: Word at Once
games.description: Players simultaneously speak a word related to a given category. If two players say the same word, they score a point. If all say different words, no points.
games.setup: Gather 3-8 players. Decide on a scoring system (first to X points wins, or most points in X rounds).
howToPlay: One person calls out a category (e.g., 'Breakfast foods', 'Superheroes', 'Countries')
On the count of three, everyone says ONE word from that category
If two or more people say the same word, those players score a point
If everyone says different words, no points (or the caller loses a point)
The person who said the unique word can be the next caller
Play continues until someone reaches the winning score

games.title: Crowd Sculpture
games.description: A group collaborates to create living statues that represent concepts, emotions, or scenes, with each person contributing part of the sculpture.
games.setup: One person is the 'sculptor' who will arrange the 'clay' (other players) into statues.
howToPlay: Designate one person as the sculptor
Other players are the clay, standing ready to be posed
The sculptor announces a theme (e.g., 'Joy', 'Rush hour', 'First date')
The sculptor physically poses each player into a frozen scene
The sculpture can be literal, abstract, or metaphorical
After creating, everyone holds the pose for 10-30 seconds
Audience (or the sculptor) can walk around and observe
New sculptor is chosen and game continues

games.title: Poison Ball
games.description: A ball is passed around a circle. When 'Poison!' is called, the person holding the ball is out. But the caller might be bluffing!
games.setup: All players stand or sit in a circle.
howToPlay: One person starts with the ball and passes it to someone else
Players pass the ball around the circle
At any moment, someone can yell 'Poison!'
The person holding the ball when 'Poison!' is called is out
But—if the caller was bluffing (there was no actual poison), they are out instead
If no one calls poison after a set time, the ball 'explodes' and the holder is out
Last person standing wins

games.title: Emotion Robots
games.description: Players are 'robots' who can only express one emotion. Participants guess which emotion each robot is feeling.
games.setup: One person leaves the room while others choose an emotion.
howToPlay: One person is the 'guesser' and leaves the room
The group secretly chooses an emotion (or picks from cards)
All players become 'robots' expressing that same emotion
The guesser returns and must identify the shared emotion
The robots can only use facial expressions and body language
No speaking allowed!
After guessing, a new person becomes the guesser
For more challenge: each robot has a different intensity of the emotion

games.title: Standing Line
games.description: The group must arrange themselves in a line (by birthday, by height, by a secret number) without speaking.
games.setup: Give each player a secret number or attribute (or use real attributes like height, birthday month).
howToPlay: Everyone receives a secret number or attribute (or just use real ones)
No speaking allowed—use gestures, facial expressions, writing in air
The group must arrange themselves in order (1-2-3... or Jan-Dec for birthdays)
When the group thinks they're done, they freeze
If correct, celebrate! If not, keep working
Try different variations: reverse order, by shoe size, by alphabet letter of name

games.title: Zip Zap Bong
games.description: A fast-paced circle game where players pass energy using 'Zip' (point to someone), 'Zap' (clap toward someone), or 'Bong' (touch head to self).
games.setup: Everyone stands or sits in a circle.
howToPlay: One person starts with an imaginary ball of energy
They choose a target and say either 'Zip', 'Zap', or 'Bong'
'Zip' = point to someone, they catch and pass to next person
'Zap' = clap toward someone, they catch and pass on
'Bong' = touch head, they keep the energy and choose new direction
Keep the energy moving as fast as possible
If someone hesitates, drops the energy, or does wrong action, they're out
Last person standing wins

games.title: One Word Story
games.description: A collaborative storytelling game where each person adds one word at a time to create a coherent (or hilariously incoherent) story.
games.setup: Gather 4-10 players in a circle.
howToPlay: First person starts the story with one word
Next person adds one word to continue the story
Continue around the circle
Each person can only say ONE word at a time
The goal is to create a coherent (or intentionally hilarious) story
If someone repeats a word already used in the story, they're out
If someone can't add a word after 5 seconds, they're out
Last person standing wins, or play for a set number of rounds

games.title: Sardines
games.description: Like hide and seek, but in reverse! One person hides, others seek. When someone finds the hiders, they hide with them.
games.setup: Designate a hiding area (indoors or outdoors) with plenty of hiding spots.
howToPlay: One person is 'It' and goes to hide
Everyone counts to 20 (or 50) with eyes closed
Everyone seeks the hidden person
When someone finds the hiders, they quietly join them
The last person to find the group is the loser/next It
Everyone must hide together—no running off alone
The hiders can try to sneak to new hiding spots

games.title: Charades
games.description: Players act out words or phrases without speaking while their team guesses within a time limit.
games.setup: Divide into teams. Prepare word cards or use a charades app.
howToPlay: Teams take turns—one actor, one guesser at a time
The actor draws a card and has 60 seconds to act it out
The actor can use: gestures, facial expressions, sound effects (no words!)
The team guesses as many as possible in the time limit
Different categories might have different point values
Teams switch: new actor, new guesser
Most points after all rounds wins

games.title: Fruit Basket
games.description: Players sit in chairs arranged in a circle, each assigned a fruit. One person stands in the middle. When their fruit is called, they must switch seats!
games.setup: Arrange chairs in a circle, one fewer than the number of players.
howToPlay: Each player is assigned a fruit (e.g., apple, banana, orange)
One person stands in the middle (the 'basket')
The person in the middle calls out fruits (e.g., 'Apples swap!')
All 'apples' must stand and find a new chair
The person in the middle also tries to grab a seat
The person left without a chair becomes the new middle person
Can call 'Fruit Basket' (everyone swaps) for chaos!

games.title: Wink Murder
games.description: A deduction game where one person is secretly the 'murderer' who can 'kill' with a wink. The detective must catch them!
games.setup: Divide into two groups: observers and players (3-6 players work best).
howToPlay: One person is chosen as the Detective and leaves the room
The group secretly chooses one person as the Murderer
The Detective returns and stays in the room
The Murderer 'kills' by winking at another player
The killed player dramatically falls/dies after being winked at
The Detective has 3 guesses to identify the Murderer
If the Detective guesses correctly, the Murderer is revealed
If guesses run out, Murderer wins and chooses next Detective

games.title: Categories (Scattergories-style)
games.description: Players fill in categories with words starting with a given letter. Creative answers score points!
games.setup: Prepare categories and a way to randomly select a letter.
howToPlay: Choose categories (e.g., Country, Animal, Food, Famous Person, Color)
Roll a letter or randomly select one
Everyone writes one word per category starting with that letter
Set a timer (2-3 minutes)
When time is up, go around and reveal answers
Unique answers score 2 points, common answers score 1
Same answer = no points for either
Letter must match exactly (no nicknames!)

games.title: Sharks and Minnows
games.description: One person is the 'shark' in the middle. Minnows try to cross from one side to the other without being tagged.
materials: Cones or lines to mark boundaries
games.setup: Set up two parallel lines about 30 feet apart. One is the start, one is the finish.
howToPlay: One person is the Shark and stands in the middle
Minnows line up at one end
On 'Go!', minnows run to the other side
The Shark tries to tag minnows with two hands
Tagged minnows become sharks in the next round
The game continues until only one minnow remains
That minnow becomes the shark for the next game
For more fun: sharks can only move sideways, or have one foot anchored

games.title: Concentration (Memory)
games.description: A card-matching game where players flip cards to find pairs. The player with the most pairs wins.
games.setup: Spread all cards face-down in a grid.
howToPlay: All players stand around the card grid
First player flips two cards face-up
If they match, the player keeps the pair and goes again
If they don't match, flip them back over in place
Next player flips two cards
Remember where cards are located!
Game ends when all pairs are found
Player with most pairs wins

games.title: Yes, Let's!
games.description: One person suggests an action, everyone responds 'Yes, let's!' and does it together. Then someone else suggests the next action.
games.setup: Everyone stands or sits in a circle.
howToPlay: One person starts by saying an action (e.g., 'Let's jump!')
Everyone responds 'Yes, let's!' and does the action together
After the action, another person says a new action
Everyone responds 'Yes, let's!' and does the new action
Keep the energy going fast!
Play until the group winds down or runs out of ideas
For variety: can add constraints (only animal actions, only quiet actions)

games.title: Telephone Pictionary
games.description: A combination of Telephone and Pictionary. One person writes a phrase, the next draws it, the next writes what they see, and so on.
materials: Long strip of paper or separate sheets
games.setup: Each player needs a piece of paper and pen. Form a line or circle.
howToPlay: First person writes a phrase and folds to hide it
Pass to the next person who draws what they read
Fold to hide the drawing, pass to next
Next person writes what they think the drawing represents
Continue alternating: draw, write, draw, write...
After all players have contributed, unfold the whole chain
Read through and laugh at the transformation!
Compare final result to the original phrase

games.title: Four Corners
games.description: One person counts while others hide in corners of the room. The 'seeker' tries to guess who's in which corner.
games.setup: Identify the four corners of the room.
howToPlay: One person is 'It' and stands in the middle, facing away
Others quietly choose a corner and go there
Everyone signals they're ready (e.g., 'Ready!')
It counts to 10 (or 20) loudly
At 'Ready, set, go!', It turns around
Everyone must freeze in their corner
It tries to identify who is in each corner
If It correctly names someone in a corner, that person is out
If wrong, the corner group stays in play
Play continues until It correctly identifies all or time runs out

games.title: Alien Language
games.description: Players must communicate using only made-up sounds and gestures, trying to complete simple tasks together.
games.setup: Create pairs or small groups. Give them a task to accomplish together.
howToPlay: Partners face each other or are divided by a barrier
Give them a task (e.g., stack these blocks, arrange these cards)
They can ONLY use sounds and gestures—no words!
They must figure out how to work together using only alien language
No pointing directly at objects or the barrier
After a few minutes, see how much they accomplished
Discuss: What worked? What was confusing?
Try again with a different task

games.title: Dodgeball
games.description: Two teams throw balls at each other. Get hit and you're out. Catch a ball and your team gets a player back!
games.setup: Divide into two teams. Set up boundaries (gym or field lines).
howToPlay: Teams line up on opposite sides of the court
All balls start in the center
On 'Go!', players run to grab balls
Players throw balls to hit opponents below the neck
If hit, player is out and goes to the sidelines
If you catch a ball (before it hits ground), your team gets one player back
If a ball is caught, the thrower is out
Last team with players standing wins

games.title: Line Up in Silence
games.description: The group must arrange themselves in a specific order (by birthday, height, etc.) without speaking. First team to finish wins.
games.setup: Divide into teams of 4-8. Give each team their own space.
howToPlay: Explain the order to achieve (e.g., by birthday month and day, by alphabetical name order)
Set a timer
Teams must arrange themselves in the correct order
NO TALKING allowed—use gestures only
When finished, the team says 'Done!' and freezes
Verify correctness—if wrong, they must fix it
First team to correctly line up wins
Play multiple rounds with different criteria

games.title: Gibberish
games.description: Players speak in made-up languages while their partner tries to guess what they're saying from context and gestures.
games.setup: Divide into pairs. One person is the speaker, one is the guesser.
howToPlay: The speaker gets a phrase to communicate
The speaker must convey the phrase WITHOUT using real words
They can: use gestures, facial expressions, made-up sounds and words
The speaker is NOT allowed to speak actual words
The partner tries to guess the phrase
Set a timer (60 seconds per round)
Score points for correct guesses
Switch roles and continue

games.title: Ninja
games.description: Players act as ninjas in a circle. On your turn, do a swift ninja move and try to 'kill' others. Last one standing wins!
games.setup: Everyone stands in a tight circle facing inward.
howToPlay: Everyone starts in a ready ninja stance
On your turn, do a swift ninja move (punch, kick, sword strike)
Aim at another player—if they react (flinch, move), they're out
If you complete your move without them reacting, they're still in
You have only ONE attempt per turn
If you miss or get hit, you're out
Play continues until one person remains
Last ninja standing wins!

games.title: Movie Pitch
games.description: Teams create movie pitches in 2 minutes. One person presents while others act out scenes. Most creative wins!
games.setup: Divide into teams of 3-6. Prepare genre cards.
howToPlay: Each team draws a genre (horror, rom-com, sci-fi, etc.)
They have 2 minutes to create a movie pitch
The pitch must include: title, main characters, conflict, ending
Each team presents their pitch to the group
They can use as many team members as they want in the presentation
Teams can act out short scenes to illustrate
Audience votes on most creative, funniest, most bizarre
Winners get bragging rights!

games.title: Switch Sides
games.description: Two lines face each other. When a category is called, those who fit must cross to the other side. No matching allowed!
games.setup: Create two lines facing each other, about 10 feet apart.
howToPlay: Divide players into two teams, each standing on opposite sides
Facilitator calls a category (e.g., 'Everyone wearing blue!')
Players who fit that category must cross to the other side
But—no two people can occupy the same spot!
Players already on that side can push others back
The last person to reach a spot (or no spot available) is out
Play continues with new categories
Last person standing wins

games.title: Story Cubes
games.description: Roll dice with pictures and create a story using all the images. Take turns adding to the narrative.
materials: Picture dice (or use apps like StoryCubes)
games.setup: Use 3-9 story cubes, depending on group size and complexity desired.
howToPlay: Roll all the dice
First player starts a story that incorporates at least one image
Next player continues the story, adding a new image
Keep going until all images are used
Try to make a coherent story, or embrace the chaos!
For competition: each player has 30 seconds to add their part
If they hesitate too long, they're out
Last player telling a complete story wins

games.title: Opposite Day
games.description: Everything is reversed! When you say 'Go', players must do the opposite of what you command.
games.setup: One person is the leader. Everyone else stands in a group.
howToPlay: Leader establishes: 'When I say GO, you must do the OPPOSITE of what I say!'
Leader gives commands: 'Touch your nose!' (players should touch something else)
Leader says 'Go!' to activate the rule
After 'Go!', any correct commands work normally
But 'Stop!' deactivates the rule
Anyone who follows a command during 'Go' phase is out
Last player standing becomes the new leader
Variation: 'Reverse Day' where everything is backward in the game

games.title: Rock Paper Scissors Tournament
games.description: A tournament style game where you play Rock Paper Scissors against opponents. Winners advance, losers become cheerleaders.
games.setup: Gather 8-30 players. Clear space for a tournament bracket or just open area.
howToPlay: Everyone finds a partner
Partners play Rock Paper Scissors
Winners find other winners, losers find other losers
Losers become cheerleaders for the winners they matched with
Continue pairing up—winners advance, losers cheer
Eventually two finalists face off
The entire group cheers for each side
The winner is crowned champion!
